document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Thyreocephalus and description of Afrus gen. nov. of Africa south of the Sahara (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylininae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined.
It was not possible to find the type /s of
Eulissus ater
, described from Senegal . All reasonable steps were exhausted to trace the original type material of this taxon. Many Laporte type specimens have been lost, but some are currently housed in the MNHNP . The curator of MNHNP searched for type material but without success. We can only conclude that the type material has been lost. To stabilise the systematic position of this species in this complex species group, we decided to designate a neotype . The specimen selected as the neotype matches the original description of Laporte ( 1840 ) and falls within the area of original type locality ( Guinea in West Africa near to Senegal ).
Neotype
♂: (by present designation):
GUINEA
: “Guin. Deyr.” ( MFNB ). The labels: “ Neotypus
Eulissus ater Lap., Bordoni & Janák
des. 2014 ” and “
Thyreocephalus ater (Lap.)
, Bordoni & Janák det. 2014 ” were attached to this specimen.

Cameron , 1952

Redescription. Body length 19–27 mm ; length from anterior margin of head to posterior margin of elytra: 12– 17 mm . Black, shiny, sometimes genital segment partly or completely reddish. Body very robust, wide. Head and pronotum with feeble micro-punctation. Head and pronotum and respective punctation as in
Fig. 75
; labrum as in
Fig. 76
. Elytra sub-rectangular, as long as pronotum and narrower that it, with sub-rectilinear and sub-parallel sides. Surface with three series of spaced punctures, one near suture, one median and one lateral. Abdomen with very fine and dense, transverse micro-striature and distinct, dense and deep punctation.
Female. Temples with similar punctation as in male or almost impunctate.

Differential diagnosis.
Thyreocephalus ater
differs from the similar
T. meridionalis
sp. nov.
in narrower body with longer pronotum and in narrower basal bulbus of the aedeagus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 75–79 .
Thyreocephalus ater
(Laporte)
; 75, head and pronotum; 76, labrum; 77, male tergite 10; 78, male sternite 9; 79, aedeagus.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. The Garamba National Park is situated in the North part of Democratic Republic of Congo , on the border with Sudan .
